intro: Didymoplexis latilabris, commonly known as the broad-lipped didymoplexis, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
